topics.body:
Ugh. . . Things are getting tight in my household financially food wise.

Dumb question; why is it that there's people that act as though if they don't get 5 pounds of meat every meal they act as though they're going to starve to death?

Do people think "Oh no!  I have to eat a salad!  I'm going to starve to death!  I can feel myself withering away already!"

You don't need 20 pounds of meat per person per month and honestly I don't think eating that much meat constantly is healthy for you either.
topics.author: 38b55cdf63616403d7560600

topics.body: my mom said if u eat a shit load, ur stomach gets more stretched out and u feel hungrier and hungrier

topics.body:
"@Princessâ™ Molestia":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/555903fd6368722f64310100#post_555903fd6368722f64310100
I hear that unlike herbivores. Humans lack a certain bacteria in us that help herbivores process an essential protein, therefore we have to get them from eating animals.

Inuit people in Northern Canada traditionally eat an entirely meat diet, because there is literally no place to farm up there in the extreme north.
topics.author: 4fde5cee945b700a970060fc

topics.body:
"@Too_Offensive":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/5559040a6368727a92810b00#post_5559040a6368727a92810b00
It's somewhat true; if you eat too much meat you're not getting enough nutrients and as a result you constantly feel hungry.  It's like eating bread; you can eat bread all you want but no matter how much you eat you'll still be hungry cause you're not getting necessary nutrients.
topics.author: 38b55cdf63616403d7560600

topics.body:
"@SeraphimDawn":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/55590453636872329a5d0100#post_55590453636872329a5d0100
Nope. We can get full proteins from combinations of plants like rice and beans.

Animal meats are just another source.
